title: Drawing, "Cayambé, Morning, from the Temple of the Sun, Quito", June 24, 1857
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache on tan wove paper
inscribed:
Caption under peaks: "3 Valle de Chillo beautiful bluish haze Cayambe from Hill of the/ Temple de Sol/ June 24th 57"  
Caption by church:  " The glazed tiled domes of the/ churches glitter as if wet, shadow/ being very dark (green)
Below at right:  "The horizon to the east was a line of/ snow, principally, lying on the summits/ of the lesser mountains and paramos"
Upper right corner: "No. 2/ morning"
description: The peak rises in the center back.  A bank of clouds hangs beneath the ranges.  Ridges bordering a valley which is marked "3" are shown in the foreground.  At bottom left  the upper parts of a steeple and of a church with a dome.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Cayambé, Morning, from the Temple of the Sun, Quito", June 24, 1857.
June 24, 1857. Graphite, brush and white gouache on tan wove paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-738.
